result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale J Zogbaum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
OWI 5th

Defendant may transfer probation to Dane County.

Conditional jail time may also be served in Dane County or any other county that will accept him.  Defendant to be eligible for huber/work release.  Specifically, Defendant is eligible for any release programs available through the jail in which he serves his time, electronic monitoring included.

Fine and costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or counseling as ordered by the agent.

$69 blood draw reimbursement cost due to Richland County.

Credit in the event of revocation:  stipulated at 2 days.

JOC AMENDED 9-7-16 as $69.00 blood draw reimbursement for Richland County was omitted from the original JOC.
Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: See specific language in conditions paragraph.  Counsel have stipulated to 2 days credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dale J Zogbaum

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dale J Zogbaum in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have reached an agreement; def will be pleading as charged to OWI 5th for probation disposition.  Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence:  withheld for 3 years probation with conditions of 1 year jail time (may be served in Dane County with work release, EM or any other release program deemed eligible), fine and costs, blood draw reimbursement to R Co.  Credit:  2 days in the event of revocation.  3 years revocation.  3 years IID upon relicensing.  AODA/driver safety plan.
Status conference on August 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dale J Zogbaum in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M states that the parties are working on resolution but needs time to get documentation on junked vehicles before being able to serve sentence in Dane County which is, ultimately, what the parties will be proposing at time of plea/sentencing; asks for late August or early September for dispo date.  8/31 set as status - likely plea/sentencing date.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dale J Zogbaum in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel request setover to 6/15.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dale J Zogbaum in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def waives prelim.  Colloquy by the court on waiver.  Information filed.  Reading waived.  Charge and rights stated.  NG plea entered.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference at 02-24-2016 09:00 am (CLERK ATTEMPTED TO NOTIFY DEF, VIA PHONE, OF THE CHANGE IN COURT DATE FROM 2/3 TO 2/24, HOWEVER, THE NUMBER ON FILE IS NO LONGER A WORKING NUMBER)

Defendant Dale J Zogbaum in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M asks that the Court set this matter over for further status and continue to allow def to waive time limits for prelim.  Status conference scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dale J Zogbaum in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal appeared by phone means for Defendant Dale J Zogbaum.  Defense has received the complaint.  Atty. M waives formal reading.  Court states the charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights including right to prelim.  Defense waives the prelim time limits.  Court accepts time limits waiver and sets 12/16 at 9 for status.  Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
